t: Luke 13
Repent or Perish
There*p were present at that season some who told Him about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices.
And Jesus answered and said to them, “Do*r you*r suppose*r that*r these*r Galileans*r were*r worse*r sinners*r than*r all*r other*ir Galileans,*r because*r they*r suffered*r such*r things?*r
I*r tell*r you,*r no;*r but*r unless*r you*r repent*r you*r will*r all*r likewise*r perish.*r

Or*r those*r eighteen*r on*r whom*r the*r tower*r in*r Siloam*r fell*r and*r killed*r them,*r do*r you*r think*r that*r they*r were*r worse*r sinners*r than*r all*r other*ir men*r who*r dwelt*r in*r Jerusalem?*r
I*r tell*r you,*r no;*r but*r unless*r you*r repent*r you*r will*r all*r likewise*r perish.”*r
The Parable of the Barren Fig Tree
He*p also spoke this parable: “A*r certain*r man*ir had*r a*r fig*r tree*r planted*r in*r his*r vineyard,*r and*r he*r came*r seeking*r fruit*r on*r it*r and*r found*r none.*r

Then*r he*r said*r to*r the*r keeper*r of*r his*r vineyard,*r ‘Look,*r for*r three*r years*r I*r have*r come*r seeking*r fruit*r on*r this*r fig*r tree*r and*r find*r none.*r Cut*r it*r down;*r why*r does*r it*r use*r up*r the*r ground?’*r
But*r he*r answered*r and*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Sir,*r let*r it*r alone*r this*r year*r also,*r until*r I*r dig*r around*r it*r and*r fertilize*r it.*ir
And*r if*r it*r bears*r fruit,*r well.*ir But*r if*r not,*r after*r that*r you*r can*r cut*r it*r down.’”*r
A Spirit of Infirmity
Now*p He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath.
And behold, there was a woman who had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years, and was bent over and could in no way raise herself*i up.
But when Jesus saw her, He called her*i to Him*i and said to her, “Woman,*r you*r are*r loosed*r from*r your*r infirmity.”*r
And He laid His*i hands on her, and immediately she was made straight, and glorified God.

But*p the ruler of the synagogue answered with indignation, because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath; and he said to the crowd, “There are six days on which men ought to work; therefore come and be healed on them, and not on the Sabbath day.”

The*p Lord then answered him and said, “Hypocrite!*r Does*r not*r each*r one*r of*r you*r on*r the*r Sabbath*r loose*r his*r ox*r or*r donkey*r from*r the*r stall,*r and*r lead*r it*ir away*r to*r water*r it?*r

So*r ought*r not*r this*r woman,*r being*r a*r daughter*r of*r Abraham,*r whom*r Satan*r has*r bound—think*r of*r it—for*r eighteen*r years,*r be*r loosed*r from*r this*r bond*r on*r the*r Sabbath?”*r
And when He said these things, all His adversaries were put to shame; and all the multitude rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by Him.
The Parable of the Mustard Seed
Then*p He said, “What*r is*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r like?*r And*r to*r what*r shall*r I*r compare*r it?*r

It*r is*r like*r a*r mustard*r seed,*r which*r a*r man*r took*r and*r put*r in*r his*r garden;*r and*r it*r grew*r and*r became*r a*r large*r tree,*r and*r the*r birds*r of*r the*r air*r nested*r in*r its*r branches.”*r
The Parable of the Leaven
And*p again He said, “To*r what*r shall*r I*r liken*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God?*r
It*r is*r like*r leaven,*r which*r a*r woman*r took*r and*r hid*r in*r three*r measures*r of*r meal*r till*r it*r was*r all*r leavened.”*r
The Narrow Way
And*p He went through the cities and villages, teaching, and journeying toward Jerusalem.
Then one said to Him, “Lord, are there few who are saved?” And*p He said to them,
“Strive*r to*r enter*r through*r the*r narrow*r gate,*r for*r many,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r will*r seek*r to*r enter*r and*r will*r not*r be*r able.*r

When*r once*r the*r Master*r of*r the*r house*r has*r risen*r up*r and*r shut*r the*r door,*r and*r you*r begin*r to*r stand*r outside*r and*r knock*r at*r the*r door,*r saying,*r ‘Lord,*r Lord,*r open*r for*r us,’*r and*r He*r will*r answer*r and*r say*r to*r you,*r ‘I*r do*r not*r know*r you,*r where*r you*r are*r from,’*r
then*r you*r will*r begin*r to*r say,*r ‘We*r ate*r and*r drank*r in*r Your*r presence,*r and*r You*r taught*r in*r our*r streets.’*r
But*r He*r will*r say,*r ‘I*r tell*r you*r I*r do*r not*r know*r you,*r where*r you*r are*r from.*r Depart*r from*r Me,*r all*r you*r workers*r of*r iniquity.’*r

There*r will*r be*r weeping*r and*r gnashing*r of*r teeth,*r when*r you*r see*r Abraham*r and*r Isaac*r and*r Jacob*r and*r all*r the*r prophets*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God,*r and*r yourselves*r thrust*r out.*r
They*r will*r come*r from*r the*r east*r and*r the*r west,*r from*r the*r north*r and*r the*r south,*r and*r sit*r down*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
And*r indeed*r there*r are*r last*r who*r will*r be*r first,*r and*r there*r are*r first*r who*r will*r be*r last.”*r
On*p that very day some Pharisees came, saying to Him, “Get out and depart from here, for Herod wants to kill You.”
And*p He said to them, “Go,*r tell*r that*r fox,*r ‘Behold,*r I*r cast*r out*r demons*r and*r perform*r cures*r today*r and*r tomorrow,*r and*r the*r third*r day*ir I*r shall*r be*r perfected.’*r
Nevertheless*r I*r must*r journey*r today,*r tomorrow,*r and*r the*r day*ir following;*r for*r it*r cannot*r be*r that*r a*r prophet*r should*r perish*r outside*r of*r Jerusalem.*r
Jesus Laments over Jerusalem

“O*rp Jerusalem,*r Jerusalem,*r the*r one*r who*r kills*r the*r prophets*r and*r stones*r those*r who*r are*r sent*r to*r her!*r How*r often*r I*r wanted*r to*r gather*r your*r children*r together,*r as*r a*r hen*r gathers*ir her*r brood*r under*r her*ir wings,*r but*r you*r were*r not*r willing!*r

See!*r Your*r house*r is*r left*r to*r you*r desolate;*r and*r assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r you*r shall*r not*r see*r Me*r until*r the*ir time*ir comes*r when*r you*r say,*r ‘Blessed*r is*r He*r who*r comes*r in*r the*r name*r of*r the*r Lord!’”*sb
